I have just come back from a great JavaOne.

I was concerned that my presentation on unit testing "Beyond JUnit - 
The Future of Developer Testing for Java" would be poorly attended 
because it was late afternoon on the last day of the conference.

Fortunately, I was wrong.

The auditorium was packed and they had to re-direct a bunch of 
people to an overflow room.  I estimate a total of 500 people 
listened to it - which is pretty good for a breakout technical 
session.

Since Alberto Savoia is not exactly an household name :-), I know 
that all these people did not come for me but for the topic.  Having 
this many people showing up for a topic with "testing" in the title 
would have been unthinkable a few years back - take it from me, I 
tried it.

I opened the talk with a slide giving credit, and thanks, for the 
growing acceptance of developer testing to Kent Beck and Eric Gamma. 
It felt great to have an appreciative audience with whom to share my 
admiration and respect for their contributions.  In a few years I 
believe that the industry will finally look back and realize that 
what Kent and Eric have set into motion is worthy of major official 
recognition.

Overall, I believe that the talk was well received and it's my 
understanding that it may be available online on the JavaOne website 
sometime soon.  

Alberto
